ingredients: 1 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Combine the flour, baking soda, and salt in a medium bowl.
In a large bowl, beat the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until creamy.
Add the eggs and vanilla extract and beat until well combined.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture and beat until just combined.
Stir in the chocolate chips and nuts (if using).
Drop rounded spoonfuls of the dough onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until golden brown.
Cool on the baking sheets for 2 minutes, then transfer to wire racks to cool completely.
Serve and enjoy!

ingredients: 2 cans (28 oz. each) whole peeled tomatoes
steps: Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the tomatoes and their juice, breaking them up with a spoon.
Stir in the vegetable broth and dried basil.
Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for 15-20 minutes, or until the tomatoes have broken down and the soup has thickened slightly.
Remove the soup from heat and use an immersion blender to puree until smooth.
Stir in the heavy cream and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot and enjoy!

ingredients: 1/2 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
steps: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
In a large bowl, beat the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until creamy.
Add the peanut butter, egg, and vanilla extract and beat until well combined.
In a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, and salt.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the peanut butter mixture and beat until just combined.
Drop rounded spoonfuls of the dough onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
Cool on the baking sheets for 2 minutes, then transfer to wire racks to cool completely.
Serve and enjoy!

ingredients: 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-size pieces
steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Add the fettuccine pasta and cook for 8-10 minutes, or until al dente.
In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the minced garlic and sauté for 1 minute.
Add the chicken and sauté for 5-7 minutes, or until cooked through.
Reduce the heat to low and add the heavy cream, Parmesan cheese, salt, and black pepper.
Stir until the cheese is melted and the sauce is heated through.
Add the cooked fettuccine to the skillet and toss to coat in the sauce.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and serve hot.

ingredients: 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-size pieces
steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Add the fettuccine pasta and cook for 8-10 minutes, or until al dente.
In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the minced garlic and sauté for 1 minute.
Add the chicken and sauté for 5-7 minutes, or until cooked through.
Reduce the heat to low and add the heavy cream, Parmesan cheese, salt, and black pepper.
Stir until the cheese is melted and the sauce is heated through.
Add the cooked fettuccine to the skillet and toss to coat in the sauce.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and serve hot.
In a large bowl, combine the cucumber, tomatoes, onion, and bell pepper.
Add the olives and feta cheese and toss to combine.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving.
Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Add the garlic and ginger and cook for 30 seconds.
Add the bell peppers, zucchini, squash, and mushrooms and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes, or until tender-crisp.
In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, honey, cornstarch, and water.
Add the sauce to the wok or skillet and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes, or until the sauce thickens and coats the vegetables.
Serve over cooked rice.
Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Cook the lasagna noodles according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and sauté until tender, about 5 minutes.
Add the zucchini, yellow squash, and bell peppers and continue to cook for another 5 minutes, until the vegetables are slightly softened.
Stir in the marinara sauce, basil, oregano, salt, and black pepper and bring to a simmer.
Reduce the heat to low and let the sauce simmer for 10 minutes.
In a large bowl, combine the ricotta cheese, spinach, and half of the shredded mozzarella cheese.
Spread a thin layer of the marinara sauce on the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Layer 3 lasagna noodles on top of the sauce, then spread a third of the ricotta mixture over the noodles.
Repeat the layers of sauce, noodles, and ricotta mixture two more times.
Top with the remaining shredded mozzarella and grated Parmesan cheeses.
Cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake for 25 minutes.
Remove the foil and bake for an additional 25 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Cool for 10 minutes before serving.
Arrange the tomato and mozzarella slices on a serving platter, alternating between the two.
Scatter the basil leaves over the tomato and mozzarella slices.
In a small bowl, whisk together the balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and serve immediately.
Enjoy!
Arrange the tomato and mozzarella slices on a serving platter, alternating between the two.
Scatter the basil leaves over the tomato and mozzarella slices.
In a small bowl, whisk together the balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and serve immediately.
Enjoy!

ingredients: 1 lb. large shrimp, peeled and deveined
steps: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
In a small bowl, combine chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, salt, and cayenne pepper.
In a large bowl, toss shrimp with olive oil, then add spice mixture and toss to coat.
Grill shrimp until pink and cooked through, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Warm tortillas on the grill, then divide shrimp among tortillas.
Top each taco with cilantro, cotija cheese, and a squeeze of lime.
Serve and enjoy!
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, balsamic vinegar, garlic, Dijon mustard, salt, and black pepper.
Place chicken breasts in a large resealable plastic bag, then pour in marinade.
Seal bag and shake to coat chicken.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 8 hours.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Remove chicken from marinade and grill until cooked through, about 5-6 minutes per side.
Let chicken rest for 5 minutes, then slice into strips.
In a large bowl, toss mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, red onion, feta cheese, and basil.
Divide salad among four plates, then top each with sliced chicken.
Serve and enjoy!
In a medium saucepan, heat the broth over low heat.
In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and mushrooms and cook until tender.
Add the rice and stir until coated with the onion and mushroom mixture.
Add the white wine and cook, stirring, until it has been absorbed by the rice.
Add a ladleful of the hot broth to the rice mixture and stir until it has been absorbed.
Continue adding broth, one ladleful at a time, stirring frequently and allowing each addition to be absorbed before adding the next, until the rice is creamy and tender.
Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the Parmesan cheese, cream, and butter.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot and enjoy!

ingredients: 1/2 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
8 oz. cream cheese, at room temperature
steps: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Line an 8-inch square baking dish with parchment paper, leaving an overhang on two sides.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, 1/4 cup granulated sugar, and salt.
Cut in the butter using a pastry blender or two knives until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Press the mixture into the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until lightly golden.
In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese and 3/4 cup granulated sugar until smooth.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time, until well combined.
Stir in the blueberries, lemon juice, lemon zest, and 1/4 cup flour.
Pour the mixture over the crust.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until set.
Let cool completely in the pan on a wire rack.
Serve hot and enjoy!
In a large bowl, combine chopped romaine, sliced onion, chopped cucumber, sliced bell pepper, and cherry tomatoes.
Add kalamata olives and crumbled feta cheese.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, minced garlic, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper.
Drizzle dressing over salad and toss to combine.
Serve and enjoy!
Cook pasta according to package instructions.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add crushed tomatoes, salt, and black pepper.
Simmer for 15-20 minutes, until sauce has thickened.
Add chopped basil and stir to combine.
Serve sauce over cooked pasta.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, garlic powder, oregano, salt, and black pepper.
Brush the chicken with the marinade and grill for 6-8 minutes per side, or until cooked through.
Let the chicken rest for 5 minutes, then slice thinly.
In a large bowl, toss together the mixed greens, red onion, feta cheese, sliced almonds, and dried cranberries.
Top the salad with the sliced chicken and drizzle with the balsamic vinaigrette.
Serve and enjoy!

ingredients: 2 cans black beans, drained and rinsed
Sour cream and sliced avocado for serving
steps: In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and sauté until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add the cumin, smoked paprika, and cayenne pepper and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Add the broth, black beans, and diced tomatoes and bring to a simmer.
Simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the soup is thick and flavorful.
Stir in the cilantro and lime juice.
Serve hot, topped with sour cream and sliced avocado if desired.
Enjoy!
Cook pasta according to package instructions.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add crushed tomatoes, salt, and black pepper.
Simmer for 15-20 minutes, until sauce has thickened.
Add chopped basil and stir to combine.
Serve sauce over cooked pasta.
Combine the olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, salt, and black pepper in a small bowl.
Place the chicken breasts in a shallow dish and pour the marinade over them.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 4 hours.
Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Remove the chicken breasts from the marinade and discard the marinade.
Grill the chicken for 6-8 minutes on each side, or until cooked through.
Let the chicken rest for a few minutes before serving.
Enjoy!

ingredients: 1 can (15 oz.) chickpeas, rinsed and drained
steps: Combine the quinoa and water in a medium saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat.
Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the water is absorbed and the quinoa is tender.
Fluff the quinoa with a fork and transfer to a large bowl.
Add the olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, salt, and black pepper and stir to combine.
Add the cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, chickpeas, feta cheese, parsley, and mint and stir to combine.
Serve at room temperature or chilled.
Enjoy!

ingredients: 1 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Combine the flour, baking soda, and salt in a medium bowl.
In a large bowl, beat the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until creamy.
Add the eggs and vanilla extract and beat until well combined.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture and beat until just combined.
Stir in the chocolate chips and nuts (if using).
Drop rounded spoonfuls of the dough onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until golden brown.

Serve and enjoy!

Add the tomatoes and their juice, breaking them up with a spoon.
Stir in the vegetable broth and dried basil.
Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for 15-20 minutes, or until the tomatoes have broken down and the soup has thickened slightly.
Remove the soup from heat and use an immersion blender to puree until smooth.
Stir in the heavy cream and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot and enjoy!

ingredients: 1/2 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
steps: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
In a large bowl, beat the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until creamy.
Add the peanut butter, egg, and vanilla extract and beat until well combined.
In a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, and salt.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the peanut butter mixture and beat until just combined.
Drop rounded spoonfuls of the dough onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
Cool on the baking sheets for 2 minutes, then transfer to wire racks to cool completely.
Serve and enjoy!

ingredients: 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-size pieces
steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Add the fettuccine pasta and cook for 8-10 minutes, or until al dente.
In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the minced garlic and sauté for 1 minute.
Add the chicken and sauté for 5-7 minutes, or until cooked through.
Reduce the heat to low and add the heavy cream, Parmesan cheese, salt, and black pepper.
Stir until the cheese is melted and the sauce is heated through.
Add the cooked fettuccine to the skillet and toss to coat in the sauce.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and serve hot.
In a large bowl, combine the cucumber, tomatoes, onion, and bell pepper.
Add the olives and feta cheese and toss to combine.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving.
Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Add the garlic and ginger and cook for 30 seconds.
Add the bell peppers, zucchini, squash, and mushrooms and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes, or until tender-crisp.
In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, honey, cornstarch, and water.
Add the sauce to the wok or skillet and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes, or until the sauce thickens and coats the vegetables.
Serve over cooked rice.
Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Cook the lasagna noodles according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and sauté until tender, about 5 minutes.
Add the zucchini, yellow squash, and bell peppers and continue to cook for another 5 minutes, until the vegetables are slightly softened.
Stir in the marinara sauce, basil, oregano, salt, and black pepper and bring to a simmer.
Reduce the heat to low and let the sauce simmer for 10 minutes.
In a large bowl, combine the ricotta cheese, spinach, and half of the shredded mozzarella cheese.
Spread a thin layer of the marinara sauce on the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Layer 3 lasagna noodles on top of the sauce, then spread a third of the ricotta mixture over the noodles.
Repeat the layers of sauce, noodles, and ricotta mixture two more times.
Top with the remaining shredded mozzarella and grated Parmesan cheeses.
Cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake for 25 minutes.
Remove the foil and bake for an additional 25 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Cool for 10 minutes before serving.
Arrange the tomato and mozzarella slices on a serving platter, alternating between the two.
Scatter the basil leaves over the tomato and mozzarella slices.
In a small bowl, whisk together the balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and serve immediately.
Enjoy!
Arrange the tomato and mozzarella slices on a serving platter, alternating between the two.
Scatter the basil leaves over the tomato and mozzarella slices.
In a small bowl, whisk together the balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and serve immediately.
Enjoy!

ingredients: 1 lb. large shrimp, peeled and deveined
steps: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
In a small bowl, combine chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, salt, and cayenne pepper.
In a large bowl, toss shrimp with olive oil, then add spice mixture and toss to coat.
Grill shrimp until pink and cooked through, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Warm tortillas on the grill, then divide shrimp among tortillas.
Top each taco with cilantro, cotija cheese, and a squeeze of lime.
Serve and enjoy!
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, balsamic vinegar, garlic, Dijon mustard, salt, and black pepper.
Place chicken breasts in a large resealable plastic bag, then pour in marinade.
Seal bag and shake to coat chicken.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 8 hours.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Remove chicken from marinade and grill until cooked through, about 5-6 minutes per side.
Let chicken rest for 5 minutes, then slice into strips.
In a large bowl, toss mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, red onion, feta cheese, and basil.
Divide salad among four plates, then top each with sliced chicken.
Serve and enjoy!
In a medium saucepan, heat the broth over low heat.
In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and mushrooms and cook until tender.
Add the rice and stir until coated with the onion and mushroom mixture.
Add the white wine and cook, stirring, until it has been absorbed by the rice.
Add a ladleful of the hot broth to the rice mixture and stir until it has been absorbed.
Continue adding broth, one ladleful at a time, stirring frequently and allowing each addition to be absorbed before adding the next, until the rice is creamy and tender.
Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the Parmesan cheese, cream, and butter.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot and enjoy!

ingredients: 1/2 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
8 oz. cream cheese, at room temperature
steps: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Line an 8-inch square baking dish with parchment paper, leaving an overhang on two sides.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, 1/4 cup granulated sugar, and salt.
Cut in the butter using a pastry blender or two knives until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Press the mixture into the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until lightly golden.
In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese and 3/4 cup granulated sugar until smooth.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time, until well combined.
Stir in the blueberries, lemon juice, lemon zest, and 1/4 cup flour.
Pour the mixture over the crust.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until set.
Let cool completely in the pan on a wire rack.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot and enjoy!
In a large bowl, combine chopped romaine, sliced onion, chopped cucumber, sliced bell pepper, and cherry tomatoes.
Add kalamata olives and crumbled feta cheese.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, minced garlic, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper.
Drizzle dressing over salad and toss to combine.
Serve and enjoy!
Cook pasta according to package instructions.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add crushed tomatoes, salt, and black pepper.
Simmer for 15-20 minutes, until sauce has thickened.
Add chopped basil and stir to combine.
Serve sauce over cooked pasta.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, garlic powder, oregano, salt, and black pepper.
Brush the chicken with the marinade and grill for 6-8 minutes per side, or until cooked through.
Let the chicken rest for 5 minutes, then slice thinly.
In a large bowl, toss together the mixed greens, red onion, feta cheese, sliced almonds, and dried cranberries.
Top the salad with the sliced chicken and drizzle with the balsamic vinaigrette.
Serve and enjoy!

ingredients: 1 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Combine the flour, baking soda, and salt in a medium bowl.
In a large bowl, beat the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until creamy.
Add the eggs and vanilla extract and beat until well combined.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture and beat until just combined.
Stir in the chocolate chips and nuts (if using).
Drop rounded spoonfuls of the dough onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until golden brown.
Cool on the baking sheets for 2 minutes, then transfer to wire racks to cool completely.
Serve and enjoy!
